comments.raw_text:
using history.pushState or history.replaceState from an addon, the Web console or scratchpad return such errors:

[16:59:17.753] [Exception... "Component returned failure code: 0x8000ffff (NS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED) [nsIDOMHistory.pushState]"  nsresult: "0x8000ffff (NS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED)"  location: "JS frame :: Web Console :: <TOP_LEVEL> :: line 1"  data: no]

test case:
1. Open the Web console
2. paste> history.pushState({}, "", "?bug")
3. there is no 3. unfortunately

Note: Doing the same in Firebug works fine.
comments.text:
using history.pushState or history.replaceState from an addon, the Web console or scratchpad return such errors:

[16:59:17.753] [Exception... "Component returned failure code: 0x8000ffff (NS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED) [nsIDOMHistory.pushState]"  nsresult: "0x8000ffff (NS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED)"  location: "JS frame :: Web Console :: <TOP_LEVEL> :: line 1"  data: no]

test case:
1. Open the Web console
2. paste> history.pushState({}, "", "?bug")
3. there is no 3. unfortunately

Note: Doing the same in Firebug works fine.
comments.creator: public@lrbabe.com
comments.author: public@lrbabe.com

comments.text: BTW, the workaround for addons is to create a script tag with the call to history API in its innerHTML and then append that tag to the document body.
comments.raw_text: BTW, the workaround for addons is to create a script tag with the call to history API in its innerHTML and then append that tag to the document body.
comments.author: public@lrbabe.com
comments.creator: public@lrbabe.com

comments.author: justin.lebar+bug@gmail.com
comments.creator: justin.lebar+bug@gmail.com
comments.text: Is this specific to pushstate?  history.back() also doesn't work for me.
comments.raw_text: Is this specific to pushstate?  history.back() also doesn't work for me.

comments.creator: public@lrbabe.com
comments.author: public@lrbabe.com
comments.text:
As the bug title says, the problem is expected to affect the whole history API.
I've only tested pushState() and replaceState() methods, though.
comments.raw_text:
As the bug title says, the problem is expected to affect the whole history API.
I've only tested pushState() and replaceState() methods, though.

comments.text: history.back() is working fine for me, but I can reproduce this with history.pushState(...).
comments.raw_text: history.back() is working fine for me, but I can reproduce this with history.pushState(...).
comments.author: torisugari@gmail.com
comments.creator: torisugari@gmail.com

comments.author: tamir.z3@gmail.com
comments.creator: tamir.z3@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: From a Greasemonkey script this I get this error only when I give a URL to history.pushState (giving only state object and title works fine). But from Scratchpad and Web Console I get this error also when I don't give a URL.
